title: Tangent Line Equation
text: The tangent line to f(x) at a is the line passing through the point (a,f(a)) having slope $$\lim_{h\to0} \frac{f{\left(a+h\right)}-f{\left(a\right)}}{h}$$.
speech: The tangent line to f(x) at a is the line passing through the point (a,f(a)) having slope ; the limit as h approaches 0, of; fraction, f of, open paren a plus h, close paren; minus f of a, over h, end fraction; .

title: Plugging In
text: As $$a=3$$ in this equation, plug $$3+h$$ into f(a).
speech: As , a is equal to, 3  in this equation, plug  3, plus h;  into f(a).

title: Simplify
speech: Simplify the resulting equation: ; fraction, fraction, 7 over, 3 plus h, end fraction; minus 7 thirds, over h, end fraction;
